text:
On tap at the brewery in Pocatello, Idaho. 
This arrived with a fine head over a clear amber body. It also had a slice of lemon which I removed. 
Light spicy bread in the aroma with suggestions of citrus. 
Flavor follows. Clean. Typical strength and bitterness for style.
On tap at the brewery Hazy light orange. Very light pale malt flavors. A bit slick body . Drinkable and soft.
On tap at portneuf brewing. Pours out a hazy straw topped with a white head. Nose is toast wheat some citrus. Taste is more of the toasted malts some wheat lemon citrus touch.

Draft sample at the brewery solely for a krystal counter. Lightly hazy gold color with a white head. Classic lager yeast aroma with a little banana ester. Crisp, clean flavor with some light, lingering bitterness. Enjoyable and true to style

Lemon light aroma. Pretty good flavor. Malty. Nice fading head. Citrus and grain. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft. Amber beer with a whitish head. Caramel and toasted malt aroma. Wheat and caramel flavor. Medium bodied. Wheat and caramel linger with grain.

On tap at the brewery 
Appearance: Cloudy golden with a small white head and some lacing 
Aroma: Bready, butterscotch and wheat 
Taste: Wheat, buttery, grainy and citrus. Sticky mouthfeel  
This was ok, light but didnt taste right.
Had on draft at the brewery.  It poured slightly cloudy. There were notes of dough, fruit, sulfur. The yeast character was muted. Meh.

draft. lightly hazed bronze. mild nose of pale malt and wheat; very light clove, light sawdust, light lemon juice. lemon juice and pale malt up front. medium acid, mild wheat character. fairly plain, and to be honest Im only drinking it for the damn tick. I have no shame.
Pours a hazy golden orange. Aromas of bread/clove/ and some fruit. Had a taste of yeasty bread with some spice.

Draft:  Hazy yellow pour with an ample white head.  Mild aroma is wheat and citrus.  Flavor is truly mild, yet oddly satisfying...  Wheat, citrus, and light hops.  The maltiness that Im noticing from the PV beers only faintly shows up here.
At brewery: Crisp and refreshingly fizzy. Malts had elements of nuts and toast, with the lightest hint of smoke. Flowery-fruity aromas and a mild bitterness followed. Decent stuff.
on tap-pours a white head and yellow color.  Aroma is mild medium malt-some sweetness.  Taste is wheat/medium malt-some sweetness, secondary hops-fruity/spicy.  Mild carbonation.
This hits the spot when it is hot outside.  Rich zesty aroma of citrus, lemony acidity, with some light fruity banana notes.  Decent
Slighly hazy gold with a creamy head and sheet lacing. Very light aromas of citrus hops and malts. Same as the nose, but lemon comes out more. So very refreshing.
2004 NABA Festival: Hazy golden brown. Thin foamy head. Sweet fruity smell. Sour taste. Hint of bananas. Good beer!
NABA 04: Light hazy dark copper with a decent head and a little sticky lacing. The aroma has a little malty with wheat & citrus. Flavor is mild, balanced, good wheat! Finishes malty and balanced.
